intro: Karrabina benthamiana, commonly known as the sandstone rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Karrabina benthamiana plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and provides nectar for pollinators.
